newsitem.title: USA: Lawsuit seeks to block Fujitsu offer for Amdahl.
newsitem.headline: Lawsuit seeks to block Fujitsu offer for Amdahl.

text.p: A lawsuit seeking to stop Fujitsu Ltd from proceeding with an offer to buy shares it does not yet own in Amdahl Corp has been filed in the Delaware Chancery Court, two law firms reprsenting plaintiffs said.

The complaint alleges that Amdahl, Fujitsu and certain of their officers and directors breached their fiduciary duty by failing to exercise their independent business judgment and by acting to the detriment of Amdahl shareholders, for the benefit of Fujitsu, the law firms said.
The law firms are Pomerantz Haudek Block & Grossman and Rosental Monhait Gross & Goddess.
A Fujitsu spokeswoman said they have not seen the complaint and so cannot comment.
Fujitsu, which already owns a 42 percent stake in Amdahl, announced its $12 a share offer or about $850 million on Wednesday.
